page.title: 03NORTHAM BURROWS
page.content:
The Burrows lie near the estuary of the Rivers Taw and Torridge. They cover approx. 650 acres. The Pebble Ridge is two miles long and keeps the sea from flooding-in on the Burrows. A man called Inkerman Rogers discovered that the force of the sea brought the pebbles forward many miles and a they travlled they were rounded, and then washed ashore to form the ridge. But the rdige is now slowly being destroyed and there is danger of flooding.
Many birds feed on the Burrows, and there is also a Golf Course. In 1973 the Burrows were mae a Country Park by Devon County Council, and hundreds of people visit the Burrows every year for recreation.
